attributes.action: Fund the cost of replacing churchill way flyovers in Liverpool city centre.
attributes.additional_details: The government should step in and help the city council instead of trying to come up with ways to make existing road cope with the traffic. Spending money on changing all the local junctions is going to cost just as much as replacing the structures.
attributes.background: Built in 1960's-1970's The flyover have been a vital part of moving around the city. Now they are closed the surrounding roads can't  copy with the volume of traffic.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it's about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for.

This is a decision for Liverpool City Council. It has been reported that the Council has decided to demolish the flyovers.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. 

You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 

You can also e-petition the council here:

http://councillors.liverpool.gov.uk/mgePetitionListDisplay.aspx?bcr=1
